alert.note: Alert for McKinley; San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 4:27PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central New Mexico, including the following counties, in northwest New Mexico, San Juan. In west central New Mexico, McKinley. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving slowly north from near Gallup into the Chuska Mountains. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Gallup, Tohatchi, Nakaibito, Narbona Pass, Brimhall Nizhoni, Crystal, Sheep Springs, Navajo, Yah-Ta-Hey, Rock Springs, Toadlena, Newcomb, Tse Bonito, Church Rock, Burnham, Manuelito, Naschitti, Coyote Canyon, Twin Lakes and Gamerco. - This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 1 and 27, U.S. Highway 491, State Roads 264, 118, and 134, as well as Reservation Roads 5, 69, 5000, 5001, 9652, and 9653. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
